alert.note: Alert for Stewart; Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 5:23PM EDT until March 25 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Stewart County in west central Georgia... Southern Webster County in west central Georgia... Southern Sumter County in west central Georgia... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 523 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Weston, or 9 miles southwest of Preston, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Americus, Plains, Leslie, De Soto, Weston, Desoto, Sumter, Lamar, Kimbrough, Croxton Crossroads, Huntington, Leveretts, Troutman, Maddox, Centerpoint, Dumas, New Era and Chambliss. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If you see wind damage...hail or flooding...wait until the storm has passed...and then call the National Weather Service toll free at 1 8 6 6 7 6 3 4 4 6 6 or tweet us your report at NWSATLANTA.
